Commentators say the challenge for the government now is to find those credible and willing to bring justice and lasting change so it won’t happen again.
Fox News Digital reached out to Phillips’ office but received no response.
Michael Saunders is a U.K.-based journalist.

title: Federal agents begin immigration operations in New Orleans and Minneapolis
summary: The Trump administration launched immigration enforcement operations in New Orleans and Minneapolis on Wednesday, a day after President Donald Trump said he would be sending National Guard troops to Louisiana.
story: The Trump administration launched immigration enforcement operations in New Orleans and Minneapolis on Wednesday, a day after President Donald Trump said he would be sending National Guard troops to Louisiana.

The Department of Homeland Security said in a statement about the New Orleans operation that it is “targeting criminal aliens roaming free thanks to sanctuary policies that force local authorities to ignore U.S. immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) arrest detainers,” or requests to hold people authorities have arrested for ICE.
Trump had not specified as of Wednesday morning how many guard troops he would send.

DHS Assistant Secretary Tricia McLaughlin said in a statement that those targeted in New Orleans include people released after being arrested for home invasion, armed robbery, grand theft auto and rape.

Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry, a Republican, has said he welcomes the administration’s intervention in the Democrat-run city, which  has logged significant drops in crime and is on pace to have its lowest number of homicides in nearly 50 years, according to crime data from the police department.

Shortly after the DHS announcement, the FBI in New Orleans said that federal agents and state police will launch a joint effort to “deter assaults on federal officers and attempts to obstruct law enforcement action” during DHS’ immigration enforcement in the city.
The Trump administration also began an immigration enforcement operation in Minneapolis, a senior law enforcement official told NBC News Wednesday.

Confirmation of that launch follows reports that the administration was planning an immigration crackdown this week in the Minneapolis-St. Paul area, where a number of Somali immigrants and their family members live.

A senior law enforcement administration official told NBC News that ICE officers are not specifically targeting Somali immigrants and their families, but may be arresting some who they allege have violated immigration laws.

On Tuesday, President Donald Trump ended a Cabinet meeting by unleashing a tirade against Minnesota’s population of Somalis, saying “they should go back to where they came from” and calling Rep. Ilhan Omar, D-Minn., “garbage.”

“I don’t want them in our country. I’ll be honest with you, OK. Somebody will say, ‘Oh, that’s not politically correct.’ I don’t care. I don’t want them in our country. Their country is no good for a reason,” Trump said. The president previously also attacked Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, calling him a slur that disparages people with disabilities.

A representative for Omar did not immediately respond to a request for comment Tuesday, but she said on X: “His obsession with me is creepy. I hope he gets the help he desperately needs.” Omar’s family fled the civil war in Somalia and lived in a Kenyan refugee camp before she moved to the U.S. and became a citizen.
The administration has paused immigration applications from 19 countries, including Somalia.

title: CDC advisers could reverse newborn hepatitis B vaccine recommendations
summary: A group of advisers to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is preparing to vote on whether the agency should scrap its long-standing recommendation that every baby get a hepatitis B vaccination within 24 hours of birth
story: A group of advisers to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is preparing to vote on whether the agency should scrap its long-standing recommendation that every baby get a hepatitis B vaccination within 24 hours of birth.

The shot — universally recommended for newborns in the U.S since the early 1990s — is credited with driving down cases of acute hepatitis B infections in kids by 99%. The virus, which can be passed from mother to baby during childbirth, can lead to liver disease and early death. There is no cure.
Despite its success, the hepatitis B vaccine has become the latest target of skeptics who question whether the benefits of the shot outweigh potential risks.

A vaccine given on “day one has a risk of neonatal fever, which causes more interventions” like blood work to determine the cause of the fever, said Dr. Kirk Milhoan, a pediatric cardiologist who practices at Driscoll Children’s Hospital in Corpus Christi, Texas.

Milhoan has been a member of the CDC’s Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) since June, when Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. fired all of its members, replacing them with his own appointees. On Monday, Milhoan was named the new ACIP chair, replacing Martin Kuldorff, a biostatistician who previously cast doubt on childhood vaccines, including the one for hepatitis B.

Dr. Sean O’Leary, a pediatric infectious disease expert and spokesman for the American Academy of Pediatrics, said he has never seen a serious reaction after “thousands of babies” have been given the hepatitis B vaccine.
“I never once saw a fever actually associated with hepatitis B vaccine,” O’Leary said at a media briefing Tuesday.

And a review of more than 400 studies found no evidence that the birth dose of the vaccines causes any short- or long-term health problems. On the contrary, the review of research, published Tuesday by the Vaccine Integrity Project, an independent group of experts led by the Center for Infectious Disease Research and Policy at the University of Minnesota, found that giving newborns the hepatitis B vaccine has prevented more than 6 million infections and nearly 1 million hospitalizations. The paper was not published in a peer-reviewed journal.

ACIP is scheduled to meet Thursday and Friday. The committee makes recommendations to the CDC director, who can then choose whether to adopt them. While a vote against newborn vaccination does not prohibit doctors from administering the shot, the panel’s recommendations influence insurance coverage.

It’s unclear whether the ACIP members would vote to eliminate or delay that first dose of a hepatitis B vaccine by a month or two. The agenda posted online as of Tuesday described the meeting in broad strokes, offering no details about who would be presenting data. A vote on the vaccine was supposed to take place at an ACIP meeting in September, but it was tabled because of confusion among committee members.

Hepatitis B can spread through sexual contact and sharing drug paraphernalia, such as needles. It can also pass from person to person if they share common household items such as toothbrushes or razors.

Milhoan said any decision to give newborns hepatitis B vaccines should be made based on clinicians’ individual assessments of the babies’ risk for infection — that is, whether a pregnant woman tests positive for the infection or has a “questionable infectious disease background.” At September’s ACIP meeting, the panel voted unanimously to recommend testing all pregnant women for hepatitis B.
But not all pregnant women receive prenatal care, and if they do, not all feel comfortable speaking frankly with their doctors.
Milhoan appeared to dismiss the argument that women may not divulge activities that could increase their risk for hepatitis B because of stigma.
“I hope they love their baby more than they love their pride,” he said.

A 2019 report showed that just 84% to 88% of pregnant women are tested for the virus. Without vaccination, 90% of babies exposed to the hepatitis B virus during birth develop chronic hepatitis, according to the American Academy of Pediatrics.

The hepatitis B vaccine is not the only immunization Milhoan has cast doubt on. He is a senior fellow at the Independent Medical Alliance — formerly known as the Front Line Covid-19 Critical Care Alliance — a group that has advocated for unproven treatments for Covid. His biography on the IMA’s website says he “is dedicated to treating patients affected by acute SARS-CoV-2 infections, Long Covid, and vaccine-related cardiovascular toxicity due to the spike protein.” Last year, he participated in an event with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., about alleged injuries associated with the shots.

Milhoan has been especially critical of Covid vaccines for their link to a small but increased risk of a heart condition called myocarditis in young men. The link was not seen in clinical trials; it was detected in 2021, soon after the shots were made available.
“The rates of myocarditis were much higher than anyone thought,” Milhoan said. He said he was labeled an “anti-vaxxer” for speaking out about the potential risk.
“People were saying, ‘Are you against the vaccines?’ I’m just trying to show you what we’re seeing,” he said.

Over the weekend, Dr. Vinay Prasad, the vaccine chief at the Food and Drug Administration, told staff members in a memo that an internal review found that at least 10 children died “after and because of” Covid vaccines and suggested the deaths were tied to myocarditis. Prasad did not provide any evidence to back up the claim.
Studies have shown that myocarditis is more commonly associated with Covid infection than vaccination.

This week’s ACIP meeting is also expected to include discussion of the use of aluminum adjuvants in vaccines. The ingredient is added to prompt the immune system to react better to vaccines. A study of more than 1 million people, published over the summer, found that aluminum adjuvants were not linked to an increased risk of 50 chronic conditions, including autoimmune diseases, allergies and autism.

The meeting follows months of upheaval within the CDC, including mass firings and significant changes to its messaging. On Nov. 19, a CDC webpage that once stated unequivocally that vaccines do not cause autism was rewritten to suggest, without evidence, that health officials had “ignored” possible links between the shots and the disorder.

title: Trump says he is pardoning Democratic Rep. Henry Cuellar, who was indicted on bribery charges
summary: President Donald Trump announced in a post to Truth Social that he would pardon Rep.
story: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump announced  Wednesday that he would pardon Rep. Henry Cuellar, D-Texas, who was indicted last year on bribery and money laundering charges.

In his Truth Social post, Trump accused Democrats of working to "attack, rob, lie, cheat, destroy, and decimate anyone who dares to oppose their Far Left Agenda, an Agenda that, if left unchecked, will obliterate our magnificent Country."

"Because of these facts, and others, I am hereby announcing my full and unconditional PARDON of beloved Texas Congressman Henry Cuellar, and Imelda," Trump said in the post, referring to Cuellar's wife, who also faces charges.
"Henry, I don’t know you, but you can sleep well tonight — Your nightmare is finally over!" the president continued.

In a letter from the Cuellars' daughters, Christina and Catherine, they urged Trump to pardon their father, arguing that they "believe that our father's independence and honesty may have contributed to how this case began."

"When you and your family faced your own challenges, we understood that pain in a very human way," they added in the letter, which Trump posted the letter to Truth Social. "We prayed for you and your family — for your strength, your peace, and your faith to stay strong — because we know that behind the headlines, there are real people who hurt, who love, and who still hope for better days."

Seth DuCharme, one of the congressman's lawyers, declined to comment. A Justice Department spokesperson did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Cueller's office did not immediately return a request for comment.

The Justice Department indicted Cuellar and his wife in May 2024 on 14 counts, including bribery, wire fraud and money laundering. In August, a U.S. district court dismissed two of the counts, which were related to alleged violations of the Foreign Agent Registration Act.

The indictment accused the couple of accepting "at least $598,000 in bribes from two foreign entities" in exchange for the congressman agreeing "to perform official acts in his capacity as a Member of Congress."

"The bribe payments were laundered, pursuant to sham consulting contracts, through a series of front companies and middlemen into shell companies owned by IMELDA CUELLAR," the initial indictment said, alleging that she "performed little or no legitimate work under the sham contracts."
The indictment accused the congressman of promising "to use the power and prestige of his office to advance" the interests of Azerbaijan and an unnamed foreign bank.
Both Cuellars pleaded not guilty.

title: Justice Department weighs charging James Comey again — with a new lead prosecutor
summary: The DOJ has not appealed a judge's dismissal of the cases against the former FBI director and New York Attorney General Letitia James.
story: WASHINGTON — More than a week after a federal judge tossed the Trump administration's cases against two of the president's top political foes, the Justice Department is weighing whether to re-indict former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James.

And the Justice Department is considering taking that step without the legal complications caused by the previous "unlawful" actions of Lindsey Halligan as the purported top federal prosecutor in the Eastern District of Virginia.

Attorney General Pam Bondi said on Nov. 24 that the Justice Department would file an "immediate appeal" of a federal judge's order dismissing the cases against Comey and James. But prosecutors have yet to do so.

A source familiar with the deliberations said Tuesday that the department is considering seeking new, untainted indictments instead of pursuing the appeals. CNN and Reuters previously reported on the deliberations.
A Justice Department representative declined to comment.

Former prosecutors and legal experts told NBC News that bringing fresh cases might be a cleaner path to pursuing the matter, although both cases will continue to face significant challenges, including arguments that they represent selective and vindictive prosecutions. The five-year statute of limitations on Comey's 2020 testimony before Congress — the basis for his September indictment — has now expired, but a provision of federal law gives prosecutors an extra six months to secure an indictment after it is dismissed in some circumstances.

Even if the Justice Department persuades another federal grand jury to indict Comey, a core issue will be whether there was an initial indictment, given that a judge found that Halligan — who took the unusual step of obtaining the indictment on her own — was unlawfully appointed. Time is less essential in James’ case over an alleged mortgage-related issue, as the statute of limitations most likely wouldn’t expire until at least March.
Comey and James both pleaded not guilty.
U.S. District Judge Cameron Currie ruled last month that Halligan "had no lawful authority" to present indictments and that her "defective appointment" had to be set aside.

Comey’s legal counsel Daniel Richman, meanwhile, is asking a federal judge to order property that was seized more than six years ago to be returned to him. In a memorandum in support for return of his property, Richman’s lawyers said the government "conducted a new warrantless search of Professor Richman’s files in September 2025 in contravention of clear constitutional rules and the attorney-client privilege.”
President Donald Trump fired Comey as FBI director in 2017.

Magistrate Judge William Fitzpatrick found in the Comey case last month that the government “likely” seized material outside the purpose and scope of its original search warrants. Attorneys for Richman say the government’s conduct “has deprived Professor Richman of his constitutional rights."

“The Court should grant Professor Richman’s motion and order the return of the files at issue, as well as any copies thereof, and enjoin the government from making any further use of the improperly seized or retained materials,” his attorneys wrote.
A federal judge asked Richman on Tuesday to file a motion for a temporary restraining order before she rules.

title: 'A nice geek from the Midwest': Leo's brand emerges during first foreign trip as pope
summary: After a quiet start, Pope Leo XI, the first American pontiff appears to have found his voice on his trip to Turkey and Lebanon.
story: After a quiet start, the first American pope appears to be finding his voice.
During his debut foreign trip, to Turkey and Lebanon, Pope Leo XIV projected a papal brand more guarded and less polarizing than that of his predecessor, Pope Francis.

But many Vatican watchers have nonetheless been impressed with his ability to deliver powerful messages — particularly on issues such as climate change, artificial intelligence, poverty and immigration — albeit in a subtler way than the man he replaced.

“Pope Leo is certainly growing into the role,” said Massimo Faggioli, a world-leading Vatican expert and professor at Trinity College Dublin. “He has resisted the temptation to give a sound bite that’s easy to use as a headline,” but “when he speaks, he says things that are quite courageous.”

For all the warm reviews, some Vatican watchers have sounded a note of caution: Leo has yet to stake out concrete positions, let alone sharp critiques, on any major issue. Doing so will almost certainly mean disappointing at least one faction in this church of 1.4 billion that he has so deftly kept onside.

Raised in Chicago, Leo, 70, spent much of his working life in Peru, before he was a surprise choice for pope at April’s conclave following the death of Francis. His lower profile meant “he was a bit of a mystery” for many Catholics, and he had “a very quiet summer” of study and preparation, Faggioli said.
That started to change as the colder months arrived, with more outspoken comments including his call last month for “deep reflection” about the treatment of detained migrants in the United States.
On Tuesday, as he held a Mass in Beirut, which was attended by an estimated 150,000 people, Leo honored a promise made by Francis, who was prevented from visiting by his late-life illness.

Leo asked “God for the gift of peace for this beloved land, marked by instability, wars and suffering,” likely a reference to the recent Israel-Hezbollah war, the fallout from a colossal portside explosion in 2020 that killed more than 200 people, and the country’s roiling economic crisis.

Though more than half of the Lebanese population is Muslim, nearly one third are Christian and 5% Catholic, according to 2022 census data. Before Lebanon, Leo visited Turkey to mark the anniversary of the foundation of the Nicene Creed, the standard statement of what all Christians — Catholics, Protestants and Orthodox — believe, including the affirmation that Jesus was the son of God.

That highlighted one of the themes of the six-day trip, which was reaching out “both to other Christian groups, but also to the government of Turkey, and, by extension, to Muslims,” according to Miles Pattenden, a historian of the Catholic Church who teaches at the University of Oxford.
That’s just one of the ways Leo has followed Francis’ relatively progressive policies and views — “but he’s done so with a very different tone and in a different way,” Pattenden said.
Though both men warned against the risks associated with AI, the tech-savvy Leo is the first pontiff “who seems at ease with the modern world” and pop culture, Pattenden added.

His down-to-earth vibe makes his papacy seem like “a sitcom in which some nice geek from the Midwest in America suddenly found that he had become pope,” Pattenden said. “He’s got this smile that suggests he himself can’t quite believe it.”

Leo is known to read his speeches word-for-word, a drastic departure from Francis’ habit of going off script. That led to several high-profile faux pas that sent his aides into damage limitation mode.

“Their gestures and outreach are similar,” said Stan Chu Ilo, a Catholic studies professor at DePaul University in Chicago. “But Pope Francis was quite evidently gregarious and extroverted in nature, whereas the reserved Pope Leo seems quite effective though in communication and has clarity in his thought.”

Even when sticking to his lines, Francis’ pointed and specific pronouncements led to clashes with other world officials, like when he challenged the U.S. on climate change and called for an investigation into whether Israel had committed genocide in Gaza.
Leo has said he supports the two-state solution between Israel and the Palestinian territories but told reporters on the plane to Lebanon that “we are friends with Israel.”

During his trip this week, Leo “spoke and acted very carefully, as if every sentence had been carefully weighted and coined, to avoid misunderstanding or blunt declaration,” said Olivier Roy, a professor at the European University Institute.

And the new pope was well received by many in Lebanon, a country still being bombed by Israel. Just a week before Leo landed in Beirut, an Israeli airstrike on the city killed Haytham Ali Tabatabai, a senior Hezbollah commander, and four other people, while injuring 28 more.

“We think he will bring for us peace, love and hope,” said Pascale Azaz, a nurse watching Leo’s address next to Beirut’s shimmering waterfront Tuesday, the last day of his trip. “We have been waiting years for this day.”
Nearby, Moussa Abdayem, a yoga instructor, said he hoped the pope “will inspire us to live in a more peaceful way” in a country where “everybody’s angry” at the swirling crises besetting his nation.

They aren’t the only ones impressed by Leo’s approach. His centrist stance appears to have calmed divisions between Catholic liberals and conservatives, some of the latter enraged by what they saw as Francis’ abandonment of liturgical traditions such as the Latin mass.
However, occupying such a middle ground does not come without risks.

The closest Leo came to criticism or censure of anyone or anything was making “a heartfelt appeal to those who hold political and social authority, here and in all countries marked by war and violence.”
He told them, "Listen to the cry of your peoples who are calling for peace!”

title: Miley Cyrus' Engagement Ring Analyzed by Jewelry Pros
summary: What is Miley Cyrus' engagement ring like? Here's what jewelers say about the cut, stone, setting and diamond weight.
story: Miley Cyrus and her longtime boyfriend Maxx Morando are taking the next step in their relationship.
After four years of dating, the couple recently got engaged, as confirmed by The New York Times.

Cyrus, 33, showed off her engagement ring at the Los Angeles premiere of "Avatar: Fire and Ash" while posing on the red carpet with Morando, a 27-year-old music producer and drummer for the band Liily.
TODAY.com has also reached out to Cyrus for comment on her engagement and details about her ring.
The ring appears to be a cushion-cut diamond between four and five carats, according to jewelry experts TODAY.com interviewed.

Laura Taylor, a jeweler specializing in engagement and wedding rings at Lorel Diamonds, says cushion-cut diamonds have a “romantic, vintage feel” and are known for “soft corners and broad facets that catch the light with flashes rather than sparkle.”
It's set in a chunky gold design, which Taylor says has been "making a return" among celebrities – see: Dua Lipa's recent engagement ring.
The diamond is surrounded by gold, rather than set in prongs, also known as a bezel-style setting.
"Not only does this keep the stone more secure, but it also helps it stand out even more,” Taylor notes.
The pairing of a classic cushion-cut diamond with the bezel setting gives it a "modern, sculptural look," which suits Cyrus' style, Taylor says.
The ring aligns with Cyrus' brand and sense of style for other reasons, jewelers say.
Ashleigh Bergman, the founder of Milestones by Ashleigh Bergman, says while the setting is classic, it's not "classically bridal" — which "conversely makes it super modern."
"It’s edgy (for bridal), but clean," she says.
Page Neal, co-founder of Bario Neal, calls the ring "modern, unfussy, bold, and deeply self-assured."
“It has the feeling of a piece chosen for the present moment in her life, not an echo of the past,” Neal says.
Neal sees the ring speaking to various trends within the jewelry space, including a shift toward elongated shapes like ovals and marquises; east-west settings and the rise of low, wearable profiles.
Jewelers who spoke to TODAY.com estimate the ring costing between $100,000 and $500,000, depending on factors like provenance of the stone, color, clarity and carat size.
While speaking with People, Cyrus offered the following thoughts on her engagement.

“The detail that I can share is that for us, our privacy and us kind of keeping it small has been something that I’ve been astounded that I’ve actually been able to have and being able to kind of have more choice,” she says.
Cyrus also explained why she thinks she and Morando have mostly been able to avoid the spotlight, saying, “I think it’s also being older, being more protective of what I’m open to sharing.”

title: Spotify Wrapped Is Back Again! How to Find Your 2025 Listening Habits
summary: Spotify Wrapped 2025 reveals Bad Bunny as top global artist and Taylor Swift dominating charts. Discover your Listening Age, new AI features and how to access yours.
story: This year's Spotify Wrapped is officially here!
Starting Dec. 3, Spotify users can now see personalized lists synthesizing their 2025 listening habits that includes their top artists, songs, albums and more.
Additionally, the streaming platform also revealed their most-streamed music, podcasts and audiobooks of 2025. Bad Bunny was this year's top global artist, followed by Taylor Swift.

This year, Spotify is including nearly a dozen new ways to make the experience even more personal. People will continue to see their top genres, have the song quiz, see how their top five artists shifted over the year, as well as get a personalized Your Top Songs 2025 playlist.

What's new this year is "listening age," while compares one's musical taste to others in their age group. There's also a "clubs" feature, which sorts listeners into six clubs defined by their unique listening style.

title: Matt Rogers Hilariously Prank Calls Jenna Bush Hager — And She Falls For It
summary: Matt Rogers prank called Jenna Bush Hager as part of Elle magazine's “Phoning It In” series.
story: Jenna Bush Hager is always there for a friend in need — even if it’s just a hilarious prank call in the end.

Matt Rogers, the “Las Culturistas” podcast co-host and a previous guest co-host on Jenna & Friends, had Jenna jokingly calling him a “butt face” after a prank call that was part of Elle magazine’s “Phoning It In” video series.

In a video shared on Instagram, Rogers did his best to sound frantic when calling Jenna and telling her he had been locked in his TODAY dressing room at Rockefeller Center after everyone had gone home.
“Jenna, I’m freaking out because I get claustrophobic,” he said.
“Wait, what? Can I call somebody for you?” Jenna replied. “What do you do?”
Rogers then did his best to raise the panic level.
“I’m literally calling 911, they’re not answering,” he said. “The police aren’t answering.”
Jenna asked him if he was locked in his dressing room.
“I’m still in my little dressing room, and I’m freaking out,” he said. “I don’t get scared a lot, but I’m so scared, I can’t breathe.”
Jenna then immediately jumped into problem-solving mode.
“OK, hold on. Take a deep breath, I’m calling Lily right now because they need to send security over for you,” she said.
With security about to get involved, Rogers had to bring the fun to a halt.
“OK, wait, stop, stop, stop!” he said. “It’s a prank call!”
“You are such a butt face!” Jenna said while laughing.
“I’m sitting here doing the Elle ‘Phoning It In’ prank calls, and I was like, ‘She just sent me this beautiful text about how we became genuine friends,’ and I was like ‘Let’s get her!’” Rogers said.
Jenna couldn’t help but be exasperated by the false alarm.
“I was calling somebody to save you!” she said.
It was the latest fun moment between the two friends.
“The way she immediately went into emergency and problem-solving mode…ok so @jennabhager is the friend we all need,” one person commented on Instagram.
“Good to know she’s on it !!!” another fan wrote.
“Also, get this man an oscar,” another commented about Rogers’ performance.

title: All About Miley Cyrus and Maxx Morando’s Relationship
summary: Miley Cyrus and her beau, Maxx Morando, are headed down the aisle.
story: Miley Cyrus and her beau, Maxx Morando, are headed down the aisle.

The singer and her musician boyfriend, who have been dating for four years, are engaged to be married. The were photographed together Dec. 1 at the Los Angeles premiere of “Avatar: Fire and Ash” with Cyrus sporting a diamond ring.

On Dec. 2, Cyrus told People magazine that she is “astounded” that she and Morando were able to have some privacy amid their engagement. “I think it’s also being older, being more protective of what I’m open to sharing,” she said.
The pair has attended multiple Hollywood events together over the years, but they have mostly kept their relationship private. Read on to find out everything Cyrus has shared about their romance.
They Attended the 2025 Oscars and 2024 Grammys Together
In March 2025, Cyrus attended the 97th Academy Awards with Morando by her side.
Before presenting an award at the ceremony, she posed on the red carpet in a black sequined Alexander McQueen gown next to Morando, who donned a classic black tuxedo and sunglasses.

The two previously stepped out together for the 2024 Grammys. Though he skipped the red carpet, the drummer sat beside Cyrus at the 66th annual award ceremony on Feb. 4, 2024. The two shared a sweet kiss at the table.
The “Flowers” singer sported big brown curls, similar to Morando’s everyday ‘do.
Cyrus had several costume changes throughout the evening. At one point, when they were photographed kissing, Cyrus wore a black lace gown while Morando donned a black and white classic tuxedo.
It was a big night for Cyrus, who took home her first two Grammy wins for record of the year and best solo pop performance, both for the hit “Flowers.”
Maxx Morando Is a Musician, Too
Morando is currently a drummer for the four-person rock band Liily. Before joining the group, he played drums for punk rock band The Regrettes from 2015 to 2018.
Liily released a self-titled EP in June 2024.
He’s Credited as a Producer and Writer on 2 Miley Cyrus Songs
As he shared on Instagram, Morando produced “Handstand” and co-produced “Violet Chemistry,” both off Cyrus’ Grammy-nominated 2023 album “Endless Summer Vacation.”

The couple teamed up again for her latest album, “Something Beautiful,” which arrived in May. Morando is credited as a writer and producer on the title track, “Prelude,” “Interlude 1,” “Interlude 2,” Walk of Fame,” “Pretend You’re God,” “Reborn” and deluxe edition track “Lockdown.”
He produced the lead single, “End of the World,” as well.
Morando celebrated the release of “Something Beautiful” in an Instagram post that included behind-the-scenes photos and videos of the album being recorded.

“Had the privilege of helping produce and write a handful of tunes on the sickest project i have ever been (a part) of,” he said in the caption. “Thank you to Miley, Shawn, Rado, Michael, Max, Ethan, Ian, Piece, JC, Pino, and all the musicians that played on this record, and having me be apart of it. This record smacks.”
He Has Co-Designed Miley Cyrus’ looks
Cyrus told Vogue in September 2021 that Morando co-created the cartoon monsters found on one of the looks she wore to music festivals that year.
“This look is a one-of-a-kind collaboration between two of my favorite emerging artists, Maxx Morando and Shane Kastl,” she told the publication about one outfit.
They Met on a Blind Date
She and Morando met on a half blind date, Cyrus said. “It was blind for me and not really for him,” she told British Vogue in May 2023. “I thought, ‘The worst that can happen is I leave.’”
The magazine noted that Morando called Cyrus during the interview. Her ringtone for him? Erykah Badu’s “Tyrone.” Cyrus joked, “I call that ‘boyfriend sexy ringtone.’”
Miley Cyrus and Maxx Morando Hit the Town
In November 2021, Cyrus shared photos on Instagram of the two together, including at the Gucci “Love Parade” in Los Angeles. She captioned the photos, “LOVE PARADE,” with a heart emoji.
The pair was also seen walking the carpet together at a Versace fashion show in LA in March 2023.
Pictures and videos were shared on social media Dec. 31, 2021, of the two cozying up together at her “Miley’s New Year’s Eve Party” special on NBC, per People.
At the event, she debuted her love song, “You.”

The lyrics read, “I got some baggage / Let’s do some damage / I am not made for no horsey and carriage / You know I’m savage / You’re looking past it / I want that late-night sweet magic / That forever lasting love / But only if it’s with you.”

title: Everything to Know About Apple Music Replay 2025
summary: Music lovers, are you ready to revisit your favorite songs and artists of 2025? Here's everything you need to know about Apple Music Replay this year.
story: Music lovers, are you ready to revisit your favorite songs and artists of 2025?

On Dec. 2, Apple Music rolled out its 2025 Apple Music Replay. Like Spotify Wrapped, Apple Music Replay compiles Apple Music users’ most played songs, albums and artists of the year, along with more personalized data about their listening habits.
The streaming platform also unveiled its 2025 Year-End charts, highlighting the year’s most played music.

If Rosé and Bruno Mars’ enduring hit duet “APT.” was your top song in 2025, you’re not alone. The song, actually released in October 2024, claimed the No. 1 spot on Apple’s Top Songs of 2025: Global chart, which tracks the most played songs on radio stations around the world.
“APT.” was also the No. 1 song on the Top 100: Shazam chart, the Top 100: Global Radio chart and the Top 100: Lyrics chart.
Read on to learn more about Apple Music Replay’s charts.
Who Were Apple Music’s Hottest Artists in 2025?
While Rosé and Bruno Mars dominated Apple Music’s charts this year, other artists were right behind them.
Gracie Abrams and Alex Warren made their debuts in the year-end charts with their respective Top 10 hits, “That’s So True” (No. 6) and “Ordinary” (No. 7).
Country music singer Morgan Wallen led all artists with 12 songs in the Top 100, including his highest-ranked song, “I’m The Problem” (No. 18).

Apple Music crowned Tyler, The Creator its 2025 Artist of the Year. The hip-hop star landed his first hit on the year-end Top Songs chart with “Sticky” (No. 42), a collaboration with Sexyy Red, GloRilla & Lil Wayne.

Kendrick Lamar and SZA were both well-represented on the Top Songs of 2025: Global chart. Five of Lamar’s songs made it into the Top 25, more than any other artist, with SZA not far behind with three songs.
In a fun twist, the duo’s collaborations “luther” (No. 2) and “30 For 30” (No. 10) both landed in top spots.

British singer Lola Young’s soulful hit “Messy” landed in the No. 2 spot on the Top 100: Shazam chart, the No. 3 spot on the Top 100: Global Radio chart and the No. 27 spot on Top Songs of 2025: Global.
Young also wrapped 2025 as the highest-ranking UK artist, finishing the year at No. 4 on Apple Music’s UK charts.
Check out all the year-end charts on Apple Music.
What Other Personalized Listening Data Can Users See?

In addition to revisiting their most played songs, albums and artists of the year on Apple Music, users can see other personalized data, including a Discovery feature showing what new artists they started listening to this year; a Loyalty feature highlighting which artists they listened to most often; and a Comebacks feature showing which artists made a return to their rotation.
Music lovers can also look to their 2025 Replay to track other personalized listening habits, such as the following:
Total minutes listenedTotal artists listenedLongest artist streakFavorite genres and more
Total minutes listened
Total artists listened
Longest artist streak
Favorite genres and more
How Can Users See Their Own 2025 Apple Music Replay?
iPhone users with iOS 18.1 can access their 2025 Apple Music Replay by opening the Apple Music app and using the Home, New or Search tabs.
For those using older iOS versions on either mobile or desktop, simply click on replay.music.apple.com.

title: Watch John Stamos Come In Smooth as Dr. Dusty Magic in 'Palm Royale' Sneak Peek: EXCLUSIVE
summary: John Stamos makes his "Palm Royale" debut as Dr. Dusty Magic in Episode 4, and TODAY.com has an exclusive clip of his charming entrance.
story: There’s a new sheriff — or should we say doctor/lawyer — in town, and his name is Dr. Dusty Magic.

John Stamos will make his “Palm Royale” debut in Episode 4 of Season 2, titled “Maxine Unwrecks a Home.” TODAY.com has your exclusive first look at his guest role and how he comes to Maxine’s (Kristen Wiig) rescue ahead of the Wednesday, Dec. 3 episode.
The clip begins with Maxine being interrogated by the police, who think she is responsible for Norma's (Carol Burnett) disappearance.
“There’s no body! No body, no death, no murder,” she tells Sergeant Tom Sanka (Rick Cosnett). “It’s the Holy Trinity of the law!”
Then, from behind the two-way mirror in the interrogation room, a switch flips and Dr. Dusty Magic makes his charming appearance.

“Amen to that,” he tells Maxine as he walks into the room, wearing a navy suit, sunglasses and cowboy hat. “Any man who is his own lawyer has a fool for a client, and you are far too pretty to be a fool.”
Dr. Dusty introduces himself as a “doctor of law and a part-time gynecologist.” He then tells Tom that he’s held Maxine for three days without any due cause or proof that she killed Norma.

Free to go, Maxine stands to leave but receives a stern warning from the sergeant. She isn't intimidated. She puts on her cat eye sunglasses and tells him, “I will own this town” before departing with Dr. Dusty.
Teasing his character’s arc this season, Stamos tells TODAY.com, “He comes on pretty strong and you kind of go, like, ‘Who is this shifty guy?’”
“He’s a lawyer slash gynecologist — and he’s pretty slick,” he adds. “He comes around at a time when (Maxine is) very vulnerable and very open and very emotional. And so, I come in so fast.”
Wiig also tells TODAY.com that when Dusty enters Maxine’s life, she has a major realization.

“I think Maxine, in meeting Dusty, has realized she does have something to offer,” Wiig says. “And she still wants what she wants. She still is reaching for that, like the money and all of that stuff, but I think she’s starting to realize she needs to be around people that care about her.”
New episodes of “Palm Royale” drop Wednesdays on Apple TV.

title: 'Heated Rivalry' Is Becoming a Phenom. How to Watch the Steamy Hockey Drama
summary: When are new episodes of Heated Rivalry? When is the show on? Here's how to watch Heated Rivalry.
story: HBO Max's newest series has viewers buzzing. "Heated Rivalry," a romantic drama inspired by Rachel Reid's book series "Game Changers," dropped its first two episodes on the streaming service on Nov. 28 and left viewers wanting more.

The TV series follows two rival hockey players, Canadian Shane Hollander (Hudson Williams) and Russian Ilya Rozanov (Connor Storrie), as they navigate their professional lives and mix business with pleasure.
Curious to know what all the fuss is about? Here's everything you need to know about "Heated Rivalry" and how to watch the rest of the season.
What Is 'Heated Rivalry' About?

When hockey rivals Shane and Ilya meet each other as rookies, sparks fly. They embark on a secret fling that turns into a “years-long journey of love, denial, and self-discovery,” per a press release.
“Heated Rivalry” follows Shane and Ilya over the course of eight years while they "chase glory on the ice while struggling to navigate their feelings off it."
A trailer for the series alludes to the covert nature of the hockey players' tryst as a woman asks Shane if there are "any gay hockey players."
"None that have said it publicly," he replies.
After hooking up with Ilya, Shane addresses him, saying, "So you're not going to tell anyone about this, are you?"

Elsewhere in the trailer, Ilya tells a woman he isn't seeing anyone and she notices that he's been texting a woman named Jane "for years." As it turns out, Jane is the name Ilya uses for Shane in his phone.

"Torn between the sport they live for and the love they can’t ignore, Shane and Ilya must decide if there is room in their fiercely competitive world for something as fragile and as powerful as real love," the press release reads.
Where to Watch 'Heated Rivalry'
"Heated Rivalry" was originally created for the Canadian streaming service Crave.
The show is available to view in the U.S. and Australia on HBO Max.
After watching the first two episodes of “Heated Rivalry,” many viewers are clamoring for more.
“Omg yes it’s happening!! I guess I don’t have to move to Canada just to watch this!😂❤,” on YouTube user commented on the trailer.
Another viewer called HBO’s decision to pick up the show “the best decision.”
“Everyone please watch this legally if you can so we can get another season!” one commented.

title: Are You Ready, Kids? Burger King Introduces SpongeBob Menu
summary: Burger King’s limited-time SpongeBob menu introduces four new items: Krabby Whopper, Cheesy Bacon Tots, Star-berry Shortcake Pie and Pineapple Float.
story: This December, a certain giggly sponge has abandoned his post at the Krusty Krab for a job on dry land — at Burger King.

On Dec. 1, BK released its new, limited-time menu in honor of “The SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants,” which hits U.S. theaters on Dec. 19. It features four “sea-sonal” creations inspired by all your favorite “SpongeBob” characters:
SpongeBob’s Krabby Whopper: A quarter-pound flame-grilled beef patty on a yellow square bun with American cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, mayo and ketchup.
SpongeBob’s Krabby Whopper: A quarter-pound flame-grilled beef patty on a yellow square bun with American cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, mayo and ketchup.

Mr. Krabs’ Cheesy Bacon Tots: Coin-shaped potato tots filled with cheese and bacon, served in a treasure chest carton.Patrick’s Star-berry Shortcake Pie: Strawberry shortcake pie slice with layers of strawberry and vanilla-flavored cream, a cookie crumb crust, shortcake cookie crumbles and pink star-shaped sprinkles.Pirate’s Frozen Pineapple Float: A frozen pineapple-flavored beverage topped with tropical-flavored cold foam.Bikini Bottom Bundle: Customers can grab all the new items, which come in a Pineapple-shaped Under the Sea Box, with a medium float and 8-piece Cheesy Bacon Tots.King Jr. Meal: The chain is also offering a special-edition King Jr. Meal in a Pineapple shaped Under the Sea Box featuring one of six collectible SpongeBob toys and a limited-edition SpongeBob crown.
Mr. Krabs’ Cheesy Bacon Tots: Coin-shaped potato tots filled with cheese and bacon, served in a treasure chest carton.

Patrick’s Star-berry Shortcake Pie: Strawberry shortcake pie slice with layers of strawberry and vanilla-flavored cream, a cookie crumb crust, shortcake cookie crumbles and pink star-shaped sprinkles.
Pirate’s Frozen Pineapple Float: A frozen pineapple-flavored beverage topped with tropical-flavored cold foam.
Bikini Bottom Bundle: Customers can grab all the new items, which come in a Pineapple-shaped Under the Sea Box, with a medium float and 8-piece Cheesy Bacon Tots.

King Jr. Meal: The chain is also offering a special-edition King Jr. Meal in a Pineapple shaped Under the Sea Box featuring one of six collectible SpongeBob toys and a limited-edition SpongeBob crown.

Royal Perks members who order items from the SpongeBob menu through the BK App can get access to exclusive meals. And  Miami-based fans can experience an exclusive BK x SpongeBob pop-up experience on Saturday, Dec. 6 and Sunday, Dec. 7 at 701 NW 37th Ave in Miami, Florida.
Of course, Burger King is not the first burger chain to team up with the porous cartoon character we all know and love.

In 2024, Wendy’s and Paramount released the Krabby Patty Kollab. The limited-time menu included a Krabby Patty Kollab Burger and tropical-flavored Pineapple Under the Sea Frosty in celebration of the 25th anniversary of “SpongeBob SquarePants.”

And McDonald’s has featured the four-sided figure in its restaurants a couple times over the years. To coincide with the 2012 Summer Olympics, the chain released 16 sports-related, SpongeBob-themed toys in its Happy Meals. And in 2021, it released 10 SpongeBob Happy Meal toys.

title: Lindsay Lohan Would Star in 'The White Lotus' on 1 Condition: EXCLUSIVE
summary: Fans want Lindsay Lohan to star in ‘White Lotus.’ Here's what she has to say about it.
story: When fans dream cast upcoming seasons of HBO’s smash hit “White Lotus,” one name comes up quite often: Lindsay Lohan.
“Mike White please put Lindsay Lohan in the next season of White Lotus,” wrote one X user, in March.
“Mike White please, we are begging you. Lindsay Lohan in The White Lotus Dubai,” wrote another user, joining the legions of other fans who have mentioned the “Mean Girls” star’s name online.

Although HBO is rumored to be scouting locations in the South of France and Paris for the upcoming fourth season — not Dubai, where Lohan now lives with her husband and son — when asked if she would like to star in an upcoming season of the twisty drama, she says she’s open.
“It depends on what the season is,” Lohan tells TODAY.com. “Maybe if they did something in Japan, like Tokyo or something.”

Speaking to TODAY.com in partnership with the Dunkin’ and digital media company Betches, Lohan is enjoying a year back in the limelight. It’s her grasp of the zeitgeist that makes her a perfect host for the 3rd annual Betch of the Year awards, which pays homage to the biggest creators, memes, and moments from pop culture down to “niche hyperfixations,” some which the star has found herself in, to be sure.

“It’s really nice when you find partnerships where everyone can have a nice time on set, and you can play with it and laugh,” she says. “I feel like sometimes we take work too seriously and we forget the child inside us, and I think it’s important to have fun and enjoy what you’re doing while you’re doing it.”

In an announcement posted to her Instagram, the “Freakier Friday,” star runs through some of the internet’s most prescient points of interest in her announcement: “Severance,” a certain pina colada from “White Lotus,” Love Island’s hilarious “mamacita” meme, and tellingly for the mother of 2-year-old Luai, the inescapable 67.
“I mean, 67 was really funny to me, just because I didn’t understand it for so long,” she says. “I’m not sure I still even do. I don’t know if we’re supposed to understand it.”

Dunkin’s Cookie Butter Cloud Latte also features prominently in the rollout, as a fan-favorite drink that made the journey from viral menu hack to official menu item. The drink features cookie butter syrup, cold foam and cookie crumbles.
The Betch of the Year nominees were unveiled Live on Betches YouTube channel at 10 a.m. ET on Dec. 1, and fans can visit the Betches website to vote. Winners will be announced the following week.

title: The Grinch Arrives at McDonald’s. See What’s in His Meal
summary: McDonald's new Grinch Meal is here for the holidays with McShaker Fries, Dill Pickle Grinch Salt and festive socks. Here's what's included in the menu.
story: We know the Grinch has dinner with himself at 6:30 (he “can’t cancel that again!”), but now we know what he’ll be having.
McDonald’s is putting a mischievous spin on the holiday season by introducing its new Grinch Meal featuring Dr. Seuss’s holiday-hating character on Dec. 2.

A collaboration between the fast food chain and Dr. Seuss Enterprises, the meal allows Mount Crumpit’s resident grump to introduce his Dill Pickle “Grinch Salt” McShaker Fries, the company announced in a press release.
The special fries, available for the first time in the U.S., bring back the McShaker bag, a long-lost McDonald’s menu item.
Customers use the McShaker bag to sprinkle dill pickle seasoning all over their fries. The fries are paired with a choice of a Big Mac or 10-piece Chicken McNuggets and a medium drink.

The normally not-nice Grinch is also sneaking a surprise gift into every meal: a pair of “spirited socks” that feature a hand-scribbled message from the Grinch telling everyone how he feels about holiday season.
The socks come in “four unhinged colors” and can be used as an makeshift Christmas stocking, as the Grinch himself can attest.

“THiS iS MY MEAL AND i DiDN’T PARTNER WiTH McDONALD’S OUT OF THE GOODNESS OF MY HEART,” the Grinch said in McDonald’s release. “i SAW AN OPPORTUNiTY TO BRiNG MiSCHiEF TO YOUR BELOVED ‘RESTAURANT’ WiTH MY DELiCiOUS CHAOS FOR THE HOLiDAYS AND i TOOK iT. SO GO AHEAD, GRAB MY MEAL STARTING DEC. 2 — YOU’RE WELCOME FOR MAKiNG YOUR HOLiDAYS iNFiNiTELY MORE iNTERESTiNG.”
McDonald’s previously offered a McShaker bag and a choice of seasonings with Shake Shake Fries, which were taken off U.S. menus sometime in the ‘90s.

“McShaker Fries have been a favorite on international menus for years, such as Sour Cream & Black Pepper McShaker Fries in Poland or Masala McShaker Fries in Canada,” a McDonald’s representative tells TODAY.com. “This is the first time in recent years that they will be available nationally in the U.S. market. “
The Grinch Meal will be available for a limited time starting Tuesday, Dec. 2 at participating restaurants, while supplies last.

The new meal is in line with the trendy zeal for all things pickled-flavored in the fast-food world, including Popeye’s pickle glaze sandwich and fried pickles, available for a limited time earlier this year, and Jimmy John’s new Picklewich, which was introduced in 2024 and uses a dill pickle in place of bread.

title: EXCLUSIVE: The 1st Full Trailer for 'People We Meet on Vacation' Is Here!
summary: The first trailer for The People We Meet on Vacation is here! See the trailer for Emily Henry's new adaptation airing on Netflix in January.
story: With the holiday season underway, many of us are taking time off from our daily 9-to-5 to enjoy new adventures. In some cases, those adventures can be life-changing.
TODAY taps into that spirit by sharing an exclusive first look at the first full-length for Netflix's upcoming rom-com "People We Meet on Vacation," premiering Jan. 9.
The trailer teases the story of free-spirited Poppy (Emily Bader) and structure-loving Alex (Tom Blyth), who have been unlikely besties for a decade.
Though the longtime pals live in different cities, they meet up every year in a fun destination for a joint summer vacation.
Over time, Poppy and Alex are forced to examine their bond when everyone around them points out they're actually a perfect opposites-attract romantic match.
Directed by Brett Haley with a screenplay by by Yulin Kuang and Amos Vernon and Nunzio Randazzo, “People We Meet on Vacation" is based on Emily Henry's 2021 bestselling novel of the same name.

“This is a movie that doesn’t just tell a love story,” director Haley previously told Netflix's official website Tudum. “It makes you feel like you’ve gone on vacation right alongside Poppy and Alex.”
The movie, which also stars Lukas Gage, Sarah Catherine Hook, Jameela Jamil, Molly Shannon, Alan Ruck, Lucien Laviscount and Alice Lee, comes with author Henry's seal of approval.

“I’ve been kind of an anxious wreck about who would play these characters,” Henry told Tudum, adding she was "confident" viewers, like her, were "going to completely fall in love" with the screen version of Poppy and Alex.

“I watched (Bader and Blyth's) chemistry read four times in 12 hours, and I loved it more every single time,” Henry shared. “The very first time I was laughing out loud, and I got so emotional by the end.”
Five of Henry's books are being adapted for the screen, including "Beach Read," "Book Lovers" and "Happy Place."

title: Whitney Leavitt Announces Exciting Broadway Role After ‘DWTS’
summary: Whitney Leavitt is heading from the ballroom to Broadway
story: Whitney Leavitt is heading from the ballroom to Broadway.

The “Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star, who showed off her dancing skills this season on “Dancing With the Stars,” announced Dec. 1 on Instagram that she will soon make her Broadway debut as she’s taking on the role of Roxie Hart in the Ambassador Theatre’s Tony-winning revival of “Chicago.”

“Grateful beyond words to ANNOUNCE that I will be joining @chicagomusical in the iconic role of Roxie Hart beginning Feb.2nd 2026! See you in New York City!” Leavitt wrote alongside a video of her wearing a little black dress and black stiletto heels, an outfit Roxie would approve of, while sitting in a chair.
In the clip, Leavitt snaps her fingers as the musical’s bouncy “Roxie” theme song plays.
Leavitt will perform as Roxie Hart for a six-week limited engagement next year, from Feb. 2 through March 15, Playbill reported.
Leavitt and her pro dance partner Mark Ballas made it all the way to the Week 10 semifinals of Season 34 before being eliminated on the Nov. 18 episode of “DWTS.”
The Utah-based reality star hinted Broadway could be in her future when she was asked to promote her upcoming projects during a Nov. 26 interview on the “Call Her Daddy” podcast.
“There’s two things I’ll tease,” Leavitt told host Alex Cooper. “One, I did just book my first movie, which is really exciting.”
Leavitt stopped short of sharing her second bit of news and instead referred to a dance routine she and Ballas performed on “DWTS.”
“What I can say is that a dance that Mark and I performed to on ‘Dancing With the Stars’ is going to come to life. And everyone’s going to know on Monday!” she said, laughing.
Leavitt and Ballas performed an Argentine tango to the song “Cell Block Tango” from “Chicago” in Week 9 of the dance competition.
Leavitt follows in the footsteps of fellow reality star Ariana Madix, who also landed the role of Roxie Hart in the Ambassador Theatre’s production of “Chicago” after competing on “DWTS” in 2023.

title: Millie Bobby Brown Tells 'Stranger Things' Co-Star Her New Name. It Ends in Hysterics
summary: Millie Bobby Brown revealed that she changed her name since marrying her husband Jake Bongiovi. Here's her new legal name.
story: Millie Bobby Brown revealed that she has changed her name since marrying husband Jake Bongiovi.
The “Stranger Things” star casually shared the news during a joint interview with co-star Noah Schnapp for VT — and even he was surprised she made the switch.

During their sit-down with the media company, the actors and close pals were tested on their friendship. Schnapp, who Brown recently confirmed is the godfather of her baby girl, was asked if he knew Brown’s full name.
“It’s Millie Bonnie Brown,” he said confidently. But it was the wrong answer. He then corrected himself and guessed, “Millie Bonnie Brown Bongovi?”
He attempted to answer the question multiple times as the two began hysterically laughing. “It’s so long!” he said through giggles.
She finally told him, and fans, that she has officially dropped Bobby and Brown from her name.
“It’s just Millie Bonnie Bongovi,” she said, revealing her new name.
She then joked that her new nickname is “Millie Bon Bon.”

The actor and Bongiovi, the son of rock star Jon Bon Jovi, got engaged in April 2023 and tied the knot last year. The rocker confirmed they said “I do” in an interview on BBC’s “The One Show” in May 2024.
“It was a very small family wedding and the bride looked gorgeous and Jake is happy as can be,” he said at the time.
In August, the couple announced that they had adopted a daughter together.
“This summer we welcomed our sweet baby girl through adoption,” they said in a joint Instagram post.
The two added, “We are beyond excited to embark on this beautiful next chapter of parenthood in both peace and privacy. And then there were 3. Love, Millie and Jake Bongiovi.”

Brown opened up about raising their baby girl, whom she said brings “endless joy,” in an interview with British Vogue published last month. She said that the pair intend to keep their daughter out of the public eye.

“For me, it’s really important to protect her and her story until she’s old enough to potentially one day share it herself,” she explained. “It’s not my place to purposefully put her in the spotlight unwillingly. If she chooses to share her personality one day with the world, like I did when I was young, that’s something we’d support. But right now, as she’s so little…”

Brown said it is her and her husband’s responsibility to “protect” their daughter from the spotlight. The pair have also chosen not to publicly reveal their daughter’s name until “she’s ready to decide for herself.”
She gushed about becoming a parent and how it has changed her outlook on life.
“The smaller things in life are so much more precious. Our days are filled with lots of cuddles and laughter and love. It’s just endless joy,” she shared.
She also complimented Bongiovi’s parenting. “We are 50-50 on everything,” she said. “That’s why I’m so grateful to have partnered with him in this life — he is just the most amazing dad.”

title: Scarlett Johansson Says She Bailed Early on 1st Date with Colin Jost: 'So Flustered'
summary: Scarlett Johansson said on TODAY with Jenna & Friends that she left her first date with Colin Jost early. She explained why.
story: Scarlett Johansson and Colin Jost have been happily married since 2020, but their relationship was almost a nonstarter.
While co-hosting "TODAY with Jenna & Friends" on Dec. 1, Johansson told Jenna Bush Hager she ended up bailing on the "Saturday Night Live" star on their first date.
While discussing awkward dating stories, Jenna asked what  Johansson's first date with Jost was like. The actor admitted that she wasn't used to dating around since she was a "serial monogamist."
“I just never got the kind of traditional like, ‘Hey, would you like to have dinner sometime?’” she explained.

Before meeting Jost, Johansson was married to actor Ryan Reynolds from 2008 to 2011. Following their divorce, she was married to journalist Romain Dauriac from 2014 to 2017. The former couple welcomed a daughter named Rose in 2014.
While recalling her first date with Jost, Johansson said they went to an Italian restaurant in the East Village.
“It was a lovely date. We had dinner at like 8 p.m. or whatever, and then afterwards he was like, ‘I would love to, you know, I’m meeting friends. Let’s go grab a drink,’” she said.
Johansson wasn't sure how to react, but followed her instincts and ended the date right then and there.

“I hadn’t dated basically ever and so I was just like, ‘I’ve got to go now. I need to leave.’ And I got home to relieve my babysitter and it was like 9:36 (p.m.) and she was like, ‘Why are you home?’” she said.
“And you were like, ‘I don’t even know,’” Jenna teased.
Johansson told her babysitter she felt "so flustered" when Jost suggested that they continue the date. Luckily, he gave her another chance.
"Later on he was like, 'I totally thought that was it. You were  acting so weird.' I panicked. I don't know," she said.
Jenna was amused by the story but agreed that first dates can be "kind of a lot."
"It's a lot of expectation or something," Johansson said.
The actor was curious to know if Jenna has ever ghosted someone or ended a first date early even though her date wanted the night to continue.
"Ghosting wasn't a thing back when I dated," Jenna said.
"Did you French exit? Did you disappear at any point?" Johansson asked.
Jenna said she has done that before and asked the actor if she's resorted to similar behavior on dates.

"That's happened to me on the only other date that I went on where I was on a blind date and there were many weird things that happened and we were going off to this other party and I just sort of like vanished," she said.
"Yeah, cause it's easier to go home and you're just like, 'What am I doing?'" Jenna said.
Johansson likes to think that her former date may have met his "future wife" at that party he ended up going to without her.
"He's fine," Jenna reassured her.

title: 'Stranger Things' Cast Then and Now: See How They've Transformed Since Season 1
summary: How old is the Stranger Things cast in real life vs. the show? See Millie Bobby Brown, Finn Wolfhard, and the rest of the cast's ages then and now.
story: The cast of “Stranger Things” is back for the fifth and final time in Hawkins, Indiana. But this time, older.
Part 1 of “Stranger Things” Season 5 airs on Netflix on Nov. 26 with the release of Part 2 and 3 to follow on Dec. 25 and Dec. 31.
A lot has changed during since “Stranger Things” premiered in 2016 — including the cast’s appearances.

Ahead of Season 4's premiere on May 27, 2022, actors Gaten Matarazzo and Noah Schnapp told TODAY that the widening gap between their real ages and their characters’ ages is always considered throughout production.

“I think it’s something that we’re always thinking about and concerned about, but it’s something that we work with pretty well,” Matarazzo said at 19. “My piece is great. I don’t think I’m getting taller for the rest of my life. I’ve been the same height since I was 14 so it’s been great for me.”
Schnapp, 17 at the time, on the other hand, said a note given to him during Season 2 was to lower his voice and shrink his stance in an effort to appear younger and smaller.
“I was like, ‘I’m not doing that,’” Schnapp said, of his Season 4 approach. “I’m not like that anymore.”
Matarazzo said the cast growing with their characters “makes sense” for the story: “The characters are at transitional periods in their lives.”
He added, “But it is crazy to see what all of us looked like when we first started.”

The series first aired nine years ago in 2016. In Season 1 of “Stranger Things,” a group of preteens discover something supernatural in their town of Hawkins, Indiana. They continue to grapple with their discovery.
Below, see how the cast looks now compared to their debuts in earlier seasons — and how their real ages compare to their characters’ ages.
Gaten Matarazzo
Real age: 23
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 16

Matarazzo stars as Dustin Henderson in the sci-fi series. Both Matarazzo and his “Stranger Things” character have cleidocranial dysplasia (CCD), a rare condition that causes teeth and bone malformations or deterioration. Matarazzo wears dentures and fundraises for CCD Smiles, an organization that pays for oral surgeries for people with the condition.
Caleb McLaughlin
Real age: 24
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 16

“Stranger Things” put Caleb McLaughlin on the map for his role as Lucas Sinclair. He’s since been in the Netflix movies “Concrete Cowboy” and “High Flying Bird.” A trained singer and dancer, McLaughlin played Simba in the Broadway show “The Lion King” from 2012 to 2014. Up next, McLaughlin is staring in the animated film “GOAT,” which is set to release in February 2026.
Noah Schnapp
Real age: 21
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 16

Scnhapp’s character, Will Byers, spends a harrowing week in the Upside Down, the alternate dimension located near Hawkins. But over here in the real world, the “Strangers Things” actor’s life is moving forward: Schnapp is a senior at the University of Pennsylvania and is on track to graduate in 2026. He told Jimmy Fallon on “The Tonight Show” in 2022 that he would be attending the Ivy League university and will be majoring in business. Schnapp also launched a product called TBH, a vegan hazelnut cocoa spread.
Millie Bobby Brown
Real age: 21
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 16

Millie Bobby Brown earned an Emmy nomination for at 13 for playing Eleven, a girl who escapes from a lab (literally). With her powerful psychic powers, Eleven is effectively the poster child for “Stranger Things.” In 2018, she became the youngest person to make the TIME 100 list. Brown also starred in the Netflix movie “Enola Holmes,” about Sherlock Holmes’ sister. Other than acting, Brown has some updates in her personal life. She married Jake Bongiovi in 2024. The couple welcomed a baby daughter in August.
Joe Keery
Real age: 33
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 20

Joe Keery’s “Stranger Things” character, Steve Harrington, was a senior in high school when the show started. He became friends with the show’s younger contingent thanks to a summer job they shared at the mall.
Keery was seen in the action-comedy “Free Guy.” As a musician, he performs under the name Djo; his song "End of Beginning" is a hit.
Priah Ferguson
Real age: 19
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 13

Priah Ferguson joined the show in Season 2 playing Erica Sinclair, Lucas’ younger sister. Ferguson told TODAY in 2019 that she feels she has a lot in common with her popular “Stranger Things” character, a fan favorite.
“Erica is confident; she’s a leader,” she said. “I’m confident, and I’m also a leader. And I feel that she likes to explore, and I kinda like to explore.”
Ferguson, who is originally from Atlanta, appeared in both the TV show “Atlanta” and the Atlanta-set short film “Glitter Ain’t Gold.”
In 2022, Ferguson starred as the daughter in the comedy horror “The Curse of Bridge Hollow.”
Finn Wolfhard
Real age: 22
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 16

Finn Wolfhard’s breakout role was as Mike Wheeler in “Stranger Things.” The Canadian actor has gone on to star in other horror projects, like the “It” movie series and “The Turning.” Wolfhard is also a musician. He was in a band, Calpurnia, from 2017 to 2019, and launched music with his new group, an indie-pop duo called the Aubreys, in 2021.
Wolfhard also appeared in “Ghostbusters: Afterlife” in 2021 and his last role was in a comedy horror film, “Hell of a Summer.”
Sadie Sink
Real age: 23
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 16

Sadie Sink joined the “Stranger Things” cast in Season Two as Max Mayfield. Max moves to Hawkins when her mom gets remarried, and she doesn’t get along with her new stepbrother, the epitome of a bully. Sink was also in the Netflix movie trilogy “Fear Street” and the music video of the 10-minute version of Taylor Swift’s “All Too Well.“ In July 2026, Sink will be on the big screens starring in “Spider-Man: Brand New Day.”
Natalia Dyer
Real age: 30
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 20

Nancy Wheeler is a senior in high school, making her one of the older characters in “Stranger Things.” She’s been in the recent movies “Things Heard and Seen” and “Yes, God, Yes.” Dyer’s relationship with Charlie Heaton, her “Stranger Things” co-star is still going strong.
Charlie Heaton
Real age: 31
Age in “Stranger Things” Season 5: 20
Charlie Heaton plays Jonathan Byers, Will’s older brother. He originally hails from the United Kingdom, and has also starred in “Shut In” and “The New Mutants.”

title: Netflix Adds New Fireplace Yule Logs From ‘Stranger Things’ and More
summary: In a TODAY exclusive, Netflix is sharing new fireplace yule logs featuring settings from "KPop Demon Hunters" and "Stranger Things."
story: Netflix is making the holiday season a bit cozier with a trio of fireplace yule logs from three of its most popular titles.

On Dec. 1, the streaming service launched three hour-long yule log fireplace specials that viewers can turn on in the background while they’re opening presents, eating dinner or celebrating in any other way.
Netflix subscribers can choose from yule logs for “Stranger Things,” “Wednesday” and “KPop Demon Hunters” and enjoy  instrumental music from each of the titles, plus hidden Easter eggs.
A Netflix spokesperson tells TODAY.com the streaming service plans to roll out additional experiences after the holidays, giving viewers something else to look forward to.
Carson Daly gave an exclusive first look at the yule logs on TODAY Dec. 1. Below, we have a closer look at what viewers can expect from each of the themed specials.
‘Stranger Things’
Just days after the fifth and final season of “Stranger Things” started rolling out on Netflix, fans of the series can now visit the Byers’ living room in the new holiday yule log.

Viewers will instantly recognize the alphabet wall lit up in Christmas lights that flicker from time to time. They’ll have an hour to spot Easter eggs like Eleven’s Eggo waffles, the popular Dungeons & Dragons game, a secret message that shows up on the lights and more.
‘Wednesday’
If you’ve been in “Wednesday” withdrawals since finishing Season 2, Netflix has a yule log special to tide you over.

The fireplace scene takes place in Principal Weems’ office at Nevermore Academy. At the beginning, Wednesday’s beloved sidekick, Thing, summons the fire by snapping his fingers then scuttles away as the roaring fireplace scene continues for an hour. Other surprises also await viewers.
‘KPop Demon Hunters’
“KPop Demon Hunters” is the gift that keeps on giving as families continue to sing along to the animated film’s biggest hits.

In the themed yule log, viewers travel to Gwi-Ma’s underworld lair and get mesmerized by glowing supernatural energy. Throughout the experience, they also get to sing along and point out fun film references.

title: Read With Jenna's December 2025 Pick Is a Classic
summary: What is Read With Jenna's December 2025 book pick? Here's what to know about the November 2024 book, Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen.
story: You might have already read Read With Jenna’s December 2025 pick — but now’s a good time for a re-read.
Jenna has selected Jane Austen’s “Pride and Prejudice” as her last choice of 2025.
“‘Pride and Prejudice’ is one of my favorite books of all time,” Jenna told TODAY.com. “I love Jane Austen so much.”
Jenna’s relationship to Austen’s novel, first published in 1813, goes back to her childhood visits to her paternal grandmother, Barbara Bush, in Maine.
"Pride and Prejudice" by Jane Austen

"My grandmother, Barbara, was the one who introduced me to Jane Austen. I'll never forget it. We listened to 'Pride and Prejudice' on tape, because yes, listening to books is reading. It was in her bedroom and I would come in every afternoon that I was staying with her in Maine. We would read it and then we'd watch the whole PBS miniseries," she remembered.

The novel, which has been adapted for the screen multiple times and re-told in countless book versions, follows the electric connection between Mr. Fitzwilliam Darcy and Elizabeth Bennett. At first, both are put off, almost repulsed, by one another. As their senses of pride and prejudice wear off, and they have to re-write their opinions of one another.
Austen is also the brain behind other works of lasting influence, like "Emma," "Persuasion," "Sense and Sensibility," "Mansfield Park" and more.
"I love that Jane Austen was one of the first to teach me about romantic love, what it means to be a woman," Jenna said.
This isn't Read With Jenna's first Austen-esque pick. Last November, Jenna picked the "Mansfield Park" retelling, "This Motherless Land" by Nikki May.
"Pride and Prejudice" is being re-issued by Vintage Classics for Austen's 250th birthday, paired with a new cover and introduction by the author Nicola Yoon.

A selection of Austen's other novels are also being repackaged with new introductions: Brandon Taylor wrote the introduction for "Persuasion," Adelle Waldman for "Northanger Abbey," Jennifer Egan for "Emma" and Lauren Groff for "Mansfield Park."
"I hope this introduces younger people to Jane Austen because she truly is the original queen," Jenna said.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Girl With Brutally Honest Reaction to Al Roker at Thanksgiving Parade Returns for 2nd Surprise
summary: Al Roker reunited with the little girl with whom he had a viral moment at the Thanksgiving Day Parade.
story: The breakout star from this year’s Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade has received another present.

On the Dec. 1 episode of TODAY, 7-year-old Elliott Austin — who went viral after she said she had already seen the Rockettes when Al Roker gave her a “golden ticket” during NBC’s coverage of the Thanksgiving Day Parade to see them — received tickets to catch the Broadway musical “Six,” also on on Dec. 1.
And, don't worry — Elliott vigorously shook her head when playfully asked if she had already seen the show.
In addition, she received a shopping spree at an American Girl store.
"Yeah!" Elliott roared in excitement upon learning about that surprise.
During the parade, Al presented Elliott, who hails from Tampa, Florida, a “golden ticket” to see the Rockettes, the iconic dance troupe celebrating their 100th anniversary this year.
Al asked Elliott, who turned 7 on Thanksgiving Day, if she was excited to see the Rockettes, prompting her very honest reply.
“I did that yesterday,” she said.
“You did that yesterday? Well, by golly, you get to see them again!” Al said, laughing.
“Yay!” Elliott said.

Elliott's mother, Casey Austin, said she had been planning to bring her daughter to New York, and to see the Rockettes, ever since she discovered her 7th birthday would fall on Thanksgiving. The response to her viral moment has been amazing, according to Austin, who said Elliott ended up in the segment after a family friend reached out to help make it happen.
“We’re still digesting it,” she said while appearing on TODAY with her daughter. “We were supposed to leave home yesterday and we ended up staying here and enjoying the city.”
Austin also said they've heard from a lot of people in their life.
"Yes, friends, teachers, family," she said.

title: Ariana Grande Gives ‘Loving Reminder’ About Body-Shaming
summary: Ariana Grande is addressing online criticism about her appearance following the “Wicked: For Good” premiere and press cycle
story: Ariana Grande is addressing online criticism about her appearance following the “Wicked: For Good” premiere and press cycle.
On Nov. 29, Grande posted an Instagram story that featured a clip from a December 2024 interview with co-star Cynthia Erivo, calling it a "loving reminder to all."
The resurfaced clip comes amid conversation online about the appearance of several members of the “Wicked: For Good” cast.
During the interview with journalist Salima Jeanne Poumbga, known professionally as Sally, Grande was asked about how she copes with societal beauty standards and critics.
The singer took the opportunity to address commentary about her appearance and defend herself, noting she’d been part of the discourse since she was a teenager in the public eye.
Grande posted the video Saturday and captioned it, “re-sharing this from last year as a loving reminder to all. I always love and appreciate our talks so much @sally !!!”

In the full clip, the interviewer pointed out that Glinda, Grande’s character in “Wicked,” subscribes to beauty standards both for herself, but also to please others. When asked how she navigates beauty expectations and the pressure to look perfect, Grande appeared emotional, calling it a “good question.”

“I’ve been kind of doing this in front of the public and a specimen in a petri dish really since I was 16 or 17,” she explained. “I have heard it all. I’ve heard every version of it, of what’s wrong with me. And then you fix it, and then it’s wrong for different reasons.”

Grande said that she would be picked apart for “even just the simplest thing,” including her appearance. She also reflected on hearing those comments at a young age, adding, “It’s hard to protect yourself from that noise.”
However, Grande also noted that the criticism is “something that is uncomfortable no matter what scale you’re experiencing it on,” whether it's directed at a celebrity or not.

“Even if you go to Thanksgiving dinner and someone’s Granny says, ‘Oh my god, you look skinnier! What happened?’ or ‘You look heavier, what happened?’” she said. “That is something that is uncomfortable and horrible no matter where it’s happening.”

Grande said that in society, “there’s a comfortability that we shouldn’t have at all,” including commenting on how other people look, speculation about what’s happening behind closed doors and what people wear.

“There’s a comfortability that people have commenting on that that I think is really dangerous,” Grande said. “I think that I’m really lucky to have the support system that I have to just know and trust that I’m beautiful. But I do know what the pressure of that noise feels like. It’s been a resident in my life since I was 17 and I just don’t invite it in anymore. It’s not welcome.”

Grande also offered advice to those experiencing a similar situation, adding, “And however you all can protect yourself from that noise, whether it’s at a family reunion or online, if you have to block people, I don’t care. If you delete the app entirely. You keep yourself safe because no one has the right to say s---.”
The singer has previously addressed commentary about her body and appearance, including responding to “concerns” about her weight in April 2023.
Grande shared a TikTok video at the time, noting in the clip that she didn’t tend to speak about rumors but made an exception given the sensitivity of the topic.

“I just wanted to address your concerns about my body and talk a little bit about what it means to a person with a body and to be seen … to be paid this close attention to,” she said. “I think we should be gentler and less comfortable commenting on people’s bodies, no matter what.”
Grande later added, “There are ways to compliment someone or to ignore something that you see that you don’t like that I think we should help each other work towards.”

title: Prince William Shouts Out Robert Irwin's 'Dancing with the Stars' Win
summary: William, Prince of Wales, is praising Robert Irwin's dancing skills just days after he was crowned this season's winner of "Dancing with the Stars."
story: William, Prince of Wales, is praising Robert Irwin's dancing skills  just days after the wildlife conservationist and his pro partner Witney Carson were crowned this season's champions on "Dancing with the Stars."
William gave the shoutout in a Nov. 29 video honoring Irwin's dad, late conservationist and "Crocodile Hunter" franchise star Steve Irwin, ahead of the 2025 Steve Irwin Gala in Brisbane.

William noted that the elder Irwin's mission was "to safeguard life on our planet" and to protect the natural world from the growing dangers of climate change. He then saluted Robert Irwin, 21, for carrying on his father's legacy and acting as a Global Ambassador for William's environmental award, the Earthshot Prize.
"We couldn’t have asked for a more passionate and committed ambassador in Robert, and he’s not a bad dancer either,” said William.

“That clearly runs in the family, too,” added William, referring to Season 21 of the dance competition in 2015 when Robert Irwin's older sister, Bindi Irwin, and pro partner Derek Hough were crowned the champions.
